(0.11471344598295596 - 1.842742976898844*i), (0.4576071087123371 - 1.4521762288752251*i), (0.7179935301525179 - 1.1747021106506952*i), (0.9642341050873913 - 0.9528360589514516*i))

// Anaconda zeta from MPMATH serves as standard
!! Z(x) = zeta ( 0.5 + i * x )

// B array computes difference from Watten computation
B = [ 0 <= x < LENGTH A ] ( A#x - Z ( 0.1*x + 2 ) )

// Zdif defines the mapping function
!! Zdif (x) = B#x

// plot full domain of points
PLOTRI Zdif [ 0 <= n < LENGTH B ] 
ENTITLED Zeta error of Watten algorithms showing full domain

// focus on domain 2..15
PLOTRI Zdif [ 0 <= n <= 130 ] 
ENTITLED Zeta error of Watten algorithms focus on 2..15 domain

//focus on 2..12
PLOTRI Zdif [ 0 <= n <= 100 ] 
ENTITLED Zeta error of Watten algorithms focus on 2..12 domain

// focus on 2..8
PLOTRI Zdif [ 0 <= n <= 60 ] 
ENTITLED Zeta error of Watten algorithms focus on 2..8 domain

// focus on 2..5
PLOTRI Zdif [ 0 <= n <= 30 ] 
ENTITLED Zeta error of Watten algorithms focus on 2..5 domain

!! Zx (x) = A#x
PLOTRI Zx [ 0 <= n < 130 ] 
ENTITLED Watten Zeta RI plot 2..15

PLOTRI Z [ 2 <= n < 15 <> 0.05 ] 
ENTITLED Anaconda MPMATH Zeta plot 2..15
